H0.text: What is the chief ore used to make aluminium. Corundum

H1.text: What is the chief ore used to make aluminium. Cryolite

H2.text: What is the chief ore used to make aluminium. Garnet

H3.text: What is the chief ore used to make aluminium. Boxite

A4.text: Bauxite is the world's main source of aluminium and gallium.

A5.text: This aluminium oxide is dissolved at a temperature of about 960 °C in molten cryolite.

A6.text: Next, this molten substance can yield metallic aluminium by passing an electric current through it in the process of electrolysis, which is called the Hall–Héroult process.

A7.text: It is obtained industrially by mining bauxite, a sedimentary rock rich in aluminium minerals.
